q: Do I need a permit in Naples for door/garage flood planks?
a: Often yes—depends on scope and product. The City cautions against "no-permit" claims; we submit drawings and specs with your application.

q: Can I 'dry floodproof' my home instead of elevating?
a: City guidance discusses dry/wet floodproofing methods; eligibility depends on building age (pre/post-FIRM) and zone. We verify your parcel before proposing.

q: Are these rated for hurricanes common in SWFL?
a: We specify systems used in Florida with documented performance (e.g., engineered aluminum planks, self-deploying dams) and provide calculations for your opening widths and loads.

q: I have a condo/HOA on the beach—what's different?
a: HOA/COA approvals, aesthetic covers, corrosion specs, and common-area egress plans; we package all submittals. Reference local luxury/waterfront patterns for credibility.
